2001:917.characters: Ready for more sales with a greener brand?

102:1590.characters: Bottles can be produced with 30% PCR content, aligning with emerging recycled content regulations.

102:1589.name: spe-page-big-header-title-copy
102:1589.characters: Are ZeroBottles™ more expensive than standard bottles?

2001:873.name: big-number-copy
2001:873.characters: Today’s consumers are prioritizing sustainability—over 70% say they prefer products with eco-friendly packaging. Retailers are following suit, requiring more sustainable options on their shelves. ZeroBottles makes it easy to meet these expectations without compromising performance or profit.

2001:877.name: internal-heading-title
2001:877.characters: 12 Things You Need to Know about ZeroBottles™

2001:1277.name: page-copy-block-copy
2001:1277.characters:
With ZeroBottles™, it’s a story of responsibility. As the first certified carbon-offset packaging solution for the nutraceutical and pharmaceutical industries, each bottle and cap is paired with climate action that offsets its full carbon footprint—from creation to delivery—through verified projects that deliver measurable results. 

Manufactured in HDPE, PET, PP, or PE plastics, ZeroBottles™ match your product’s needs while maintaining full compliance, performance, and cost efficiency, and can even be crafted with up to 30% post-consumer recycled content to meet upcoming regulations and retailer requirements. Backed by ClimatePartner, every bottle carries a traceable impact—real projects, real results. It’s not just sustainable—it’s accountable.

2001:1258.name: product-hero-eyebrow
2001:1258.characters: the sustainable packaging solution that sells

value.characters: Where are BioBottles™ manufactured?
They are manufactured in the USA, ensuring quality and reliable supply.
What is PlasticIQ™ Technology?
It’s a proprietary additive that stimulates bacteria and microorganisms into treating the plastic as a natural food source, accelerating safe biodegradation.
Is ZeroBottles™ certified carbon neutral?
Yes. Each bottle is ClimatePartner certified and offset through wind and solar projects.

2001:1282.name: With ZeroBottles™, it’s a story of responsibility. 2001:1282.characters:
With ZeroBottles™, it’s a story of responsibility. As the first certified carbon-offset packaging solution for the nutraceutical and pharmaceutical industries, each bottle and cap is paired with climate action that offsets its full carbon footprint—from creation to delivery—through verified projects that deliver measurable results. 

Manufactured in HDPE, PET, PP, or PE plastics, ZeroBottles™ match your product’s needs while maintaining full compliance, performance, and cost efficiency, and can even be crafted with up to 30% post-consumer recycled content to meet upcoming regulations and retailer requirements. Backed by ClimatePartner, every bottle carries a traceable impact—real projects, real results. It’s not just sustainable—it’s accountable.

value.characters: Are BioBottles™ recyclable?
Yes. They are 100% recyclable and can enter existing recycling streams.
How long is shelf life before degradation begins?
BioBottles™ remain stable and fully functional for over 5 years under normal storage conditions.
Where are BioBottles™ manufactured?
They are manufactured in the USA, ensuring quality and reliable supply.
Are BioBottles™ recyclable?
Yes. They are 100% recyclable and can enter existing recycling streams.
Are BioBottles™ food-grade safe?
Yes. BioBottles™ are FDA-compliant and meet food-grade standards.
Do BioBottles™ meet regulatory standards?
Yes. They comply with ASTM D6954, BS 8472, AFNOR T51-808, SASO 2879/2016, and other international oxo-biodegradable standards.
Why Brands Choose BioBottles®

Brands are switching to BioBottle because it delivers sustainability without compromise—no microplastics, no added cost, and no changes to existing production lines. It helps companies meet both retail and regulatory goals while reducing long-term environmental impact, making it a smart choice for the future.

2001:1276.name: page-copy-block-title
2001:1276.characters: What Is Your Product’s Sustainable Story?

value.characters: Customers Are Thinking Beyond the Purchase

Today’s consumers want packaging that reflects real-world environmental values—especially when it comes to what happens after disposal. BioBottles™ offers a verifiable, science-backed solution that balances performance, compliance, and biodegradability—making it easier for brands to align with both customer values and retailer expectations.
3 Things You Need to Know about BioBottles®

97:17882.name: product-hero
97:17882.accessibleLabel: Close-up photo of a bookshelf with old books.

value.characters: the MICROPLASTIC FREE  bottle  that CONSUMERS DEMAND
BIOBOTTLES™
Free your brand from microplastics
FDA food grade compliant
Shelf Stable 5+ Years
what happens to your bottle after use?
Finally sustainability without microplastics!

With BioBottles®, your packaging tells a better end-of-life story. Designed for the nutraceutical and pharmaceutical industries, BioBottles™ uses Plastic IQ™ technology to trigger biodegradation only after disposal, helping reduce environmental impact without disrupting shelf stability or supply chain workflows.  Once exposed to microbes, oxygen, or UV light, each bottle begins to safely biodegrade into CO₂, water, and biomass—with no harmful microplastics left behind. BioBottles™ are FDA food-grade compliant, recyclable, made in the USA, and shelf-stable for up to five years.
Do they leave behind microplastics?
No. BioBottles™ break down into oxygen, CO₂, and renewable organic material — leaving no microplastic residue.

2001:1281.name: What Is Your Product’s Sustainable Story?
2001:1281.characters: What Is Your Product’s Sustainable Story?

value.characters: Are BioBottles™ recyclable?
Yes. They are 100% recyclable and can enter existing recycling streams.
What is PlasticIQ™ Technology?
It’s a proprietary additive that stimulates bacteria and microorganisms into treating the plastic as a natural food source, accelerating safe biodegradation.
Will they increase my packaging costs?
No. BioBottles™ are cost-comparable to traditional bottles, averaging no more than 5–10¢ more per unit.
Are BioBottles™ food-grade safe?
Yes. BioBottles™ are FDA-compliant and meet food-grade standards.
Is ZeroBottles™ certified carbon neutral?
Yes. Each bottle is ClimatePartner certified and offset through wind and solar projects.
Why Brands Choose BioBottles®

Brands are switching to BioBottle because it delivers sustainability without compromise—no microplastics, no added cost, and no changes to existing production lines. It helps companies meet both retail and regulatory goals while reducing long-term environmental impact, making it a smart choice for the future.
Do BioBottles™ meet regulatory standards?
Yes. They comply with ASTM D6954, BS 8472, AFNOR T51-808, SASO 2879/2016, and other international oxo-biodegradable standards.
Built to Break Down—Not Break Your Workflow

BioBottles™ is the first biodegradable bottle of its kind for supplements and pharmaceuticals. It performs like traditional plastic during production and storage but begins to biodegrade naturally after it's thrown away—delivering smart packaging without added cost or complexity.
More Things to Know about BioBottles®
Do they leave behind microplastics?
No. BioBottles™ break down into oxygen, CO₂, and renewable organic material — leaving no microplastic residue.

BioBottles™ offers a verifiable, science-backed solution that balances performance, compliance, and biodegradability—making it easier for brands to align with both customer values and retailer expectations.
Will they increase my packaging costs?
No. BioBottles™ are cost-comparable to traditional bottles, averaging no more than 5–10¢ more per unit.
More Things to Know about BioBottles®

They are manufactured in the USA, ensuring quality and reliable supply.

value.characters: what happens to your bottle after use?
Finally sustainability without microplastics!

With BioBottles®, your packaging tells a better end-of-life story. Designed for the nutraceutical and pharmaceutical industries, BioBottles™ uses Plastic IQ™ technology to trigger biodegradation only after disposal, helping reduce environmental impact without disrupting shelf stability or supply chain workflows.  Once exposed to microbes, oxygen, or UV light, each bottle begins to safely biodegrade into CO₂, water, and biomass—with no harmful microplastics left behind. BioBottles™ are FDA food-grade compliant, recyclable, made in the USA, and shelf-stable for up to five years.
Do they leave behind microplastics?
No. BioBottles™ break down into oxygen, CO₂, and renewable organic material — leaving no microplastic residue.
Do BioBottles™ work with my existing production lines?
Yes. They run on existing equipment without reformulation, downtime, or operational changes.
Customers Are Thinking Beyond the Purchase

Today’s consumers want packaging that reflects real-world environmental values—especially when it comes to what happens after disposal. BioBottles™ offers a verifiable, science-backed solution that balances performance, compliance, and biodegradability—making it easier for brands to align with both customer values and retailer expectations.
Can I get custom colors or branding?
Yes. Standard stock comes in black and white, but custom color matching is available.
What scientific proof supports this?
Independent studies (e.g., Queen Mary University of London) show BioBottles™ degrade up to 90 times faster than ordinary plastic and are non-toxic on land and sea.
Is ZeroBottles™ certified carbon neutral?
Yes. Each bottle is ClimatePartner certified and offset through wind and solar projects.
